alert.note: Alert for Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 2:18PM CDT until May 31 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Webster County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 830 PM CDT Wednesday. * At 218 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Webster County This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 93 and 95...and near mile marker 97...and between mile markers 103 and 108. This includes the following low water crossings... Pomme De Terre River at Greenwood Road and Niangua River at Highway Y. This includes the following streams and drainages... Pomme de Terre River, Selph Branch, South Fork Pomme de Terre River, James River, North Fork Pomme de Terre River, Starvey Creek, East Fork Niangua River, Givins Branch, Grier Branch, Niangua River and West Fork Niangua River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
